Summary: This infection, also known as tinea cruris, typically causes itchy, scaly, red patches of skin on the groin area.
It most often affects teenage and adult men, especially those who are obese, or who wear tight - fitting underwear.It is the most common type of tinea.
Duration: With proper treatment, both jock itch usually improve within one to two weeks.
Symptoms: Red, ring - like patches in the groin area.
